intro: Calendula palaestina, commonly known as the Palestinian marigold, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its bright yellow to orange flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has hairy, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers bloom from late spring to early autumn, and it thrives in well-drained soil. Calendula palaestina is often used in traditional medicine for its anti-inflammatory and antiseptic properties.
